SEARCH
Package com.example.spring.Controller

Class TrainerController

java.lang.Object
com.example.spring.Controller.TrainerController
@RestController @RequestMapping("api/Trainers") public class TrainerController extends Object
The TrainerController class handles HTTP requests related to trainer entities. It defines REST endpoints for CRUD operations on trainers.

  • Method Details

    • createTrainer

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Trainer> createTrainer(@RequestBody Trainer trainer)
      REST endpoint to create a new trainer.
      Parameters:
      trainer - The trainer data to be created.
      Returns:
      The created trainer and HTTP status code 201 (Created) if successful.

    • getTrainerById

      @GetMapping("{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Trainer> getTrainerById(@PathVariable("id") int trainerId)
      REST endpoint to retrieve a trainer by ID.
      Parameters:
      trainerId - The ID of the trainer to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The trainer with the specified ID and HTTP status code 200 (OK) if found.

    • getAllTrainers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Trainer>> getAllTrainers()
      REST endpoint to retrieve all trainers.
      Returns:
      A list of all trainers and HTTP status code 200 (OK).

    • updateTrainer

      @PutMapping("{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Trainer> updateTrainer(@PathVariable("id") int trainerId, @RequestBody Trainer trainer)
      REST endpoint to update an existing trainer.
      Parameters:
      trainerId - The ID of the trainer to update.
      trainer - The updated trainer data.
      Returns:
      The updated trainer and HTTP status code 200 (OK) if successful.

    • deleteTrainer

      @DeleteMapping("{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteTrainer(@PathVariable("id") int trainerId)
      REST endpoint to delete a trainer by ID.
      Parameters:
      trainerId - The ID of the trainer to delete.
      Returns:
      A success message and HTTP status code 200 (OK) if deletion is successful.
